newsitem.title: USA: Datakey Inc says sees lower year revenue.
newsitem.headline: Datakey Inc says sees lower year revenue.

text.p: Datakey said Wednesday it expected total revenue in 1996 to be lower than in 1995 because of delays in shipment of a new product and because of a drop in fourth-quarter business.
The comapny said it was experiencing delays in shipment of the new SignaSURE electronic document manager because it was introduced to the market later than expected.
"In addition, we are experiencing a general softness in business during the fourth quarter from some of our significant customers," Datakey President and CEO John Underwood said in a statement.

"As previously disclosed, we will not be profitable in 1996 due to continuing significant investments in product development and research," Underwood said in the statement released with the company's third quarter earnings.
But Underwood said the new data security products had strong sales potential and should enable the company to grow at an accelerated pace in the future.
In 1995, Datakey reported total revenue of $7.2 million.
Earlier Wednesday, the company reported a third-quarter net loss of $298,000, or $0.10 per share, compared to a third-quarter profit last year of $24,000, or $0.01 per share.
